definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: These words seems so lonely, like those roaming dogs in streets.
sentences.chinese: 它們那麼寥落，象是倉皇街上的流浪狗。

sentences.english: Some of these dogs do not have a home.
sentences.chinese: 有些狗沒有家，成爲了流浪狗。
過着一種準流浪狗的生活。

sentences.english: He ran a homeless shelter or, better yet, a shelter for dogs.
sentences.chinese: 他爲無家可歸的人或者流浪狗提供一個避難所。

sentences.english: This will limit the number of stray dogs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 這將會減少流浪狗在這一區域的數量。

sentences.english: Stray dogs roam the streets among collapsed houses.
sentences.chinese: 流浪狗遊蕩於街上的廢棄房屋。

sentences.english: Do not tease roaming dogs and macaque.
sentences.chinese: 不要去欺負流浪狗和短尾猿。

sentences.english: Sean has devoted himself to saving stray dogs in Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 尚恩全心投入於拯救臺北的流浪狗。

sentences.english: Stray dogs may carry African Typhus disease.
sentences.chinese: 流浪狗可能帶有非洲斑疹傷寒疾病。

sentences.english: People are always missed and tormented, make a pitiful vagrant dog in missing.
sentences.chinese: 人總是被思念折磨，在思念裏做一個可憐的流浪狗。

sentences.english: It's the law. After the waving, the stray dogs chased us out of town.
sentences.chinese: 揮別以後，流浪狗一直追出鎮外。

definition: native dog/mole cricket (colloquial word for agricultural pest Gryllotalpa 螻蛄|蝼蛄[lou2 gu1])
(neologism) (coll.) pet owner (lit. "official in charge of cleaning up poop")
